ist_nodes.name: GraphType
ist_nodes.description:
Different algorithms to make the sparse graph with weighted edges
from the multidimensional mesh. Main difference is dealing with 
neighborings of elements of different dimension.

values.name: any_neighboring
values.description: Add edge for any pair of neighboring elements.

values.name: any_wight_lower_dim_cuts
values.description: Same as before and assign higher weight to cuts of lower dimension in order to make them stick to one face.

values.name: same_dimension_neghboring

values.name: none
values.description: Homogeneous Neumann boundary condition. Zero flux

values.name: dirichlet
values.description: Dirichlet boundary condition. Specify the pressure head through the 'bc_pressure' field or the piezometric head through the 'bc_piezo_head' field.

values.name: total_flux
values.description: Flux boundary condition (combines Neumann and Robin type). Water inflow equal to (($q^N + \sigma (h^R - h)$)). Specify the water inflow by the 'bc_flux' field, the transition coefficient by 'bc_robin_sigma' and the reference pressure head or pieozmetric head through 'bc_pressure' or 'bc_piezo_head' respectively.

values.name: seepage
values.description: Seepage face boundary condition. Pressure and inflow bounded from above. Boundary with potential seepage flow is described by the pair of inequalities:(($h \le h_d^D$)) and (($ q \le q_d^N$)), where the equality holds in at least one of them. Caution! Setting $q_d^N$ strictly negativemay lead to an ill posed problem since a positive outflow is enforced.Parameters (($h_d^D$)) and (($q_d^N$)) are given by fields ``bc_pressure`` (or ``bc_piezo_head``) and ``bc_flux`` respectively.

values.name: river
values.description: River boundary condition. For the water level above the bedrock, (($H > H^S$)), the Robin boundary condition is used with the inflow given by: (( $q^N + \sigma(H^D - H)$)). For the water level under the bedrock, constant infiltration is used (( $q^N + \sigma(H^D - H^S)$)). Parameters: ``bc_pressure``, ``bc_switch_pressure``, ``bc_sigma, ``bc_flux``.

ist_nodes.description: Parameters to a non-linear solver.

keys.description: Linear solver for MH problem.
Residual tolerance.
Maximal number of iterations (linear solves) of the non-linear solver.

If a stagnation of the nonlinear solver is detected the solver stops. A divergence is reported by default forcing the end of the simulation. Setting this flag to 'true', the solverends with convergence success on stagnation, but report warning about it.

ist_nodes.name: LinSys
ist_nodes.description: Linear solver setting.

ist_nodes.name: Petsc
ist_nodes.description:
Interface to PETSc solvers. Convergence criteria is:
 ```norm( res_n )  < max( norm( res_0 ) * r_tol, a_tol )```
where res_i is the residuum vector after i-th iteration of the solver and res_0 is an estimate of the norm of initial residual.
If the initial guess of the solution is provided (usually only for transient equations) the residual of this estimate is used,
otherwise the norm of preconditioned RHS is used.
The default norm is L2 norm of preconditioned residual: (($ P^{-1}(Ax-b)$)), usage of other norm may be prescribed using the 'option' key.
See also PETSc documentation for KSPSetNormType.

keys.description: Sub-record Selection.
Relative residual tolerance,  (to initial error).

default.value: Defalut value set by nonlinear solver or equation. If not we use value 1.0e-7.

keys.description: Absolute residual tolerance.

default.value: Defalut value set by nonlinear solver or equation. If not we use value 1.0e-11.

keys.description: Maximum number of outer iterations of the linear solver.

default.value: Defalut value set by nonlinear solver or equation. If not we use value 1000.

keys.description: Options passed to PETSC before creating KSP instead of default setting.

default.value: Defalut value set by nonlinear solver or equation. If not we use value 1000.

keys.description: Maximum number of iterations of the linear solver with non-decreasing residual.
Number of levels in the multilevel method (=2 for the standard BDDC).

ist_nodes.name: ObservePoint
ist_nodes.description:
Specification of the observation point. The actual observe element and the observe point on it is determined as follows:

1. Find an initial element containing the initial point. If no such element exists we report the error.
2. Use BFS starting from the inital element to find the 'observe element'. The observe element is the closest element 3. Find the closest projection of the inital point on the observe element and snap this projection according to the 'snap_dim'.

keys.description: Optional point name. Has to be unique. Any string that is valid YAML key in record without any quoting can be used howeverusing just alpha-numerical characters and underscore instead of the space is recommended.

default.value: Default name have the form 'obs_<id>', where 'id' is the rank of the point on the input.

keys.description: Initial point for the observe point search.

The dimension of the sub-element to which center we snap. For value 4 no snapping is done. For values 0 up to 3 the element containing the initial point is found and then the observepoint is snapped to the nearest center of the sub-element of the given dimension. E.g. for dimension 2 we snap to the nearest center of the face of the initial element.
The region of the initial element for snapping. Without snapping we make a projection to the initial element.
Maximum number of levels of the breadth first search used to find the observe element from the initial element. Value zero means to search only the initial element itself.

ist_nodes.name: EquationOutput
ist_nodes.description: Output of the equation's fields.The output is done through the output stream of the associated balance law equation.The stream defines output format for the full space information in selected times and observe points for the full time information. The key 'fields' select the fields for the full spatial output.The set of output times may be specified  per field otherwise common time set 'times' is used. If even this is not providedthe time set of the output_stream is used. The initial time of the equation is automatically added to the time set of every selected field. The end time of the equation is automatically added to the common output time set.

keys.description: Output times used for the output fields without is own time series specification.
Add all input time points of the equation, mentioned in the 'input_fields' list, also as the output points.

Record to set fields of the equation.
The fields are set only on the domain specified by one of the keys: 'region', 'rid'
and after the time given by the key 'time'. The field setting can be overridden by
 any Solute_Advection_FV_Data record that comes later in the boundary data array.

keys.description: Labels of the regions where to set fields.
ID of the region where to set fields.

attributes.obsolete:
Specification of the region by its ID is obsolete, will be removed in release 3.0.
Use region label declared in the Mesh record or default label 'region_<ID>'.

keys.description:
Apply field setting in this record after this time.
These times have to form an increasing sequence.
Mobile porosity (($[-]$))
Density of concentration sources. (($[m^{-3}kgs^{-1}]$))
Concentration flux. (($[s^{-1}]$))
Concentration sources threshold. (($[m^{-3}kg]$))
Boundary conditions for concentrations. (($[m^{-3}kg]$))
Initial concentrations. (($[m^{-3}kg]$))

ist_nodes.name: EquationOutput
ist_nodes.description: Output of the equation's fields.The output is done through the output stream of the associated balance law equation.The stream defines output format for the full space information in selected times and observe points for the full time information. The key 'fields' select the fields for the full spatial output.The set of output times may be specified  per field otherwise common time set 'times' is used. If even this is not providedthe time set of the output_stream is used. The initial time of the equation is automatically added to the time set of every selected field. The end time of the equation is automatically added to the common output time set.

keys.description: Output times used for the output fields without is own time series specification.
Add all input time points of the equation, mentioned in the 'input_fields' list, also as the output points.
Array of output fields and their individual output settings.
Array of the fields evaluated in the observe points of the associated output stream.

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> R
ist_nodes.description: Abstract for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldConstant
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> R Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record Selection.

Value of the constant field.
For vector values, you can use scalar value to enter constant vector.
For square (($N\times N$))-matrix values, you can use:
 - vector of size (($N$)) to enter diagonal matrix

 - vector of size (($\frac12N(N+1)$)) to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
 - scalar to enter multiple of the unit matrix.

ist_nodes.name: Solute_AdvectionDiffusion_BC_Type
ist_nodes.description: Types of boundary conditions for advection-diffusion solute transport model.

values.name: inflow
values.description:
Default transport boundary condition.
On water inflow (($(q_w \le 0)$)), total flux is given by the reference concentration 'bc_conc'. On water outflow we prescribe zero diffusive flux, i.e. the mass flows out only due to advection.

values.name: dirichlet
values.description:
Dirichlet boundary condition (($ c = c_D $)).
The prescribed concentration (($c_D$)) is specified by the field 'bc_conc'.

values.name: total_flux
values.description:
Total mass flux boundary condition.
The prescribed total incoming flux can have the general form (($\delta(f_N+\sigma_R(c_R-c) )$)), where the absolute flux (($f_N$)) is specified by the field 'bc_flux', the transition parameter (($\sigma_R$)) by 'bc_robin_sigma', and the reference concentration (($c_R$)) by 'bc_conc'.

values.name: diffusive_flux
values.description:
Diffusive flux boundary condition.
The prescribed incoming mass flux due to diffusion can have the general form (($\delta(f_N+\sigma_R(c_R-c) )$)), where the absolute flux (($f_N$)) is specified by the field 'bc_flux', the transition parameter (($\sigma_R$)) by 'bc_robin_sigma', and the reference concentration (($c_R$)) by 'bc_conc'.

ist_nodes.name: DG_variant
ist_nodes.description: Type of penalty term.

values.name: non-symmetric
values.description: non-symmetric weighted interior penalty DG method

values.name: incomplete
values.description: incomplete weighted interior penalty DG method

values.name: symmetric
values.description: symmetric weighted interior penalty DG method

ist_nodes.name: ReactionTerm
ist_nodes.description: Equation for reading information about simple chemical reactions.

ist_nodes.name: FirstOrderReaction
ist_nodes.description: A model of first order chemical reactions (decompositions of a reactant into products).

keys.description: Sub-record Selection.
An array of first order chemical reactions.
Numerical solver for the system of first order ordinary differential equations coming from the model.

ist_nodes.name: Reaction
ist_nodes.description: Describes a single first order chemical reaction.

keys.description: An array of reactants. Do not use array, reactions with only one reactant (decays) are implemented at the moment!
The reaction rate coefficient of the first order reaction.
An array of products.

ist_nodes.name: FirstOrderReactionReactant
ist_nodes.description: A record describing a reactant of a reaction.

keys.description: The name of the reactant.

ist_nodes.name: FirstOrderReactionProduct
ist_nodes.description: A record describing a product of a reaction.

keys.description: The name of the product.

The branching ratio of the product when there are more products.
The value must be positive. Further, the branching ratios of all products are normalized in order to sum to one.
The default value 1.0, should only be used in the case of single product.

ist_nodes.name: PadeApproximant
ist_nodes.description: Record with an information about pade approximant parameters.Note that stable method is guaranteed only if d-n=1 or d-n=2, where d=degree of denominator and n=degree of nominator. In those cases the Pade approximant corresponds to an implicit Runge-Kutta method which is both A- and L-stable. The default values n=2, d=3 yield relatively good precision while keeping the order moderately low.

keys.description: Polynomial degree of the nominator of Pade approximant.
Polynomial degree of the denominator of Pade approximant

ist_nodes.name: RadioactiveDecay
ist_nodes.description: A model of a radioactive decay and possibly of a decay chain.

keys.description: Sub-record Selection.
An array of radioactive decays.
Numerical solver for the system of first order ordinary differential equations coming from the model.

ist_nodes.name: Decay
ist_nodes.description: A model of a radioactive decay.

keys.description: The name of the parent radionuclide.
The half life of the parent radionuclide in seconds.
An array of the decay products (daughters).

ist_nodes.name: RadioactiveDecayProduct
ist_nodes.description: A record describing a product of a radioactive decay.

keys.description: The name of the product.
Not used at the moment! The released energy in MeV from the decay of the radionuclide into the product.

The branching ratio of the product when there is more than one.Considering only one product, the default ratio 1.0 is used.Its value must be positive. Further, the branching ratios of all products are normalizedby their sum, so the sum then gives 1.0 (this also resolves possible rounding errors).

ist_nodes.name: Heat_BC_Type
ist_nodes.description: Types of boundary conditions for heat transfer model.

values.name: inflow
values.description:
Default heat transfer boundary condition.
On water inflow (($(q_w \le 0)$)), total energy flux is given by the reference temperature 'bc_temperature'. On water outflow we prescribe zero diffusive flux, i.e. the energy flows out only due to advection.

values.name: dirichlet
values.description:
Dirichlet boundary condition (($T = T_D $)).
The prescribed temperature (($T_D$)) is specified by the field 'bc_temperature'.

values.name: total_flux
values.description:
Total energy flux boundary condition.
The prescribed incoming total flux can have the general form (($\delta(f_N+\sigma_R(T_R-T) )$)), where the absolute flux (($f_N$)) is specified by the field 'bc_flux', the transition parameter (($\sigma_R$)) by 'bc_robin_sigma', and the reference temperature (($T_R$)) by 'bc_temperature'.

values.name: diffusive_flux
values.description:
Diffusive flux boundary condition.
The prescribed incoming energy flux due to diffusion can have the general form (($\delta(f_N+\sigma_R(T_R-T) )$)), where the absolute flux (($f_N$)) is specified by the field 'bc_flux', the transition parameter (($\sigma_R$)) by 'bc_robin_sigma', and the reference temperature (($T_R$)) by 'bc_temperature'.

ist_nodes.name: EquationOutput
ist_nodes.description: Output of the equation's fields.The output is done through the output stream of the associated balance law equation.The stream defines output format for the full space information in selected times and observe points for the full time information. The key 'fields' select the fields for the full spatial output.The set of output times may be specified  per field otherwise common time set 'times' is used. If even this is not providedthe time set of the output_stream is used. The initial time of the equation is automatically added to the time set of every selected field. The end time of the equation is automatically added to the common output time set.
